content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really fun. Easy and accessible, the explanation are clear and simple

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting and fun. Not too hard for clash of code and works well as a problem.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting in shortest mode too. Can you enable it ?

Cool exercise, but can we have Egyptian cat names ? :upside_down_face:

Out of joking, I think you should precise if a cat is considered present or absent during the year of its birth and death.

"speicific "

Otherwise, what is the goal to have a variable "cat_name" ?
No point. Adds some fun to the level.

As mentioned by pioupiou26, please correct the typo to "specific".

Also, in the "10 cats long duration" validator, there is one cat Snowflake whose year of death (variable d) is the same as the year being asked about (variable M). Similar case for Maple in the "10 cats short duration" test. I assume that cat was at least living for part of that year?

(In contrast, the year of *birth* of Badger in the latter test is the same as the year being asked about.)

I think it is better to clarify in Goal section whether to count a cat when M is equal to the year of birth or the year of death.

There are duplicated names in one case (Truffle in "10 cats long duration" test). Not sure if any player will use those names in their code, but maybe it's better not to have duplicated names, or at least mention such a possibility in Goal section as a warning?

Then in the "100 cats 100 years" test, the cat Petunia has b = d, which is in violation of the constraint which says b < d. Please fix it.

And finally in the "100 cats 100 years" validator, the cat Jameson has d = 101, which is in violation of the constraint which says d < 100. Please fix that case too.

Thanks.

Fixed to notes. 
Thank you very much, very insightful
